description: This circular walk takes you up to Gutter Tor in the Dartmoor National Park. You can start the walk from the Gutter Tor car park which lies just north of the tor. From here you can pick up a footpath heading south to the tor. There's some interesting rock formations and excellent views over Dartmoor from the elevated spot. The route then continues on to Ditsworthy Warren where there is a Grade II listed house which was used as a filming location for the Steven Spielberg film, War Horse in 2010. From here the route heads north along Edward's Path to return you to the car park. You can extend the walk by heading north to climb Sheepstor and enjoy some fine views over Burrator Reservoir .
